ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my reading and listening comprehension in Chinese. I also learned a lot of new vocabulary and grammar structures to increase my fluency, allowing me to formulate more complex sentences and engage in basic conversation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the class is very fun, you learned a ton, and the department is well organized to rapidly accelerate your Chinese
Weaknesses: too much work, and many of the independent projects/presentations don't go well with course content

Strength: The professor is the best professor I've had at Yale. I learned a lot.
Weakness: Be prepared to put in 20-30 hours a week to do well in this course.
I think that the workload can be overwhelming at times but I appreciate the holistic approach to language learning that this course provides.

I really enjoyed this course, especially my professor. Li laoshi really cares about her students and her dedication to the class and our learning really shows. She makes an effort every day to make sure students are engaged and learning the material. So I'd definitely say the daily class engagement in this course is one of its main strengths. This is where I was able to improve my fluency the most and catch my mistakes when speaking. The workload sometimes felt like a lot, but it was definitely worth it. I feel as though the homework was where we could put our skills to practice and improve the most. Overall, I think this course is great. I don't think I'd be able to learn so much of a new language in such a short span of time anywhere else. The only weakness would be that for oral tests we don't receive much feedback. I understand that the TAs put in a lot of effort to grade these tests, but we aren't informed about how to access their feedback.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course to any student interested in learning chinese.
If you really want to learn Chinese and can handle the time commitment, yes.
Yes I would. The teacher is amazing, although prepared to put in the work.
I would recommend this class with the caveat that it requires more work than all of my other classes.

If you are interested in learning Chinese, then I'd definitely recommend this course. But only take this course if you are actually dedicated to learning the language. It certainly isn't easy, but I'd say regardless it's a very rewarding experience. Especially if you have a good professor, this class can be super fun. For me, it was something I looked forward to every day, despite it being early in the morning.
